ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Lag in zones
ygData.msgSnippet: It s graphics in certain spots that do it. The gates/militia house area of FP is one, and the ramp of MM is another. The platform by zone at the top is
ygData.messageBody:
It's graphics in certain spots that do it. The gates/militia house area of FP is one, and the ramp of MM is another. The platform by zone at the top is lagless, as is the bottom, but the ramp itself...major lag. It's gotta be a code issue, the video card I have is one of the best.
----- Original Message -----
From: Su
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, January 08, 2002 10:44 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Lag in zones

I have an AMD Athlon 1.4Ghz processor, Nvidia GeForce 2 MX 64Mb with TV out,
Philips PSC706 Acoustic Edge 5.1 sound card, and 1.2Gb of RAM.
I haven't been into Rivervale since upgrading my RAM but I still experience
lag in other zones. Sometimes lag spikes hit and I go almost LD 5 times
before the lag stops and I can continue. But that usually coincides with a
couple of my group members actually going LD so I'm pretty sure it is a
server side problem. I will take a character to Rivervale later and check it
out.
luv,
-Su

> I just added the necessary memory to max out my system.
> Unfortunately, that max is 256. I would love to go to 512 or more,
> but that would require a new system.
>
> Things have improved with the added memory, but I still get lots of
> lag in Rivervale, and similar town type zones. My graphics card is an
> Nvidia TNT 64 (don't know what the 64 means, it is 32meg). It is the
> best I could find last year for the money I had, and more than
> adequate for the game at that time. I needed pci, so my choices were
> a bit limited. More than that, my knowledge was much less in those
> days.
>
> I am curious as to what kinds of graphics cards people use, and
> whether or not they are experiencing lag in zones like Rivervale in
> spite of having a pretty good system.
>
> Anyone have a killer rig, and still find lag or other problems? I
> just wonder how much is the game, how much my now low end system.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
>
>
